meanings.definition: Defoliators: organisms that remove the leaves from trees and plants
meanings.sent1: The defoliators, like caterpillars and beetles, ate all the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent2: Farmers are concerned about the defoliators damaging their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous defoliators played a prank by hiding all the leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The defoliators stripped the tree bare, leaving it looking like a skeleton.
meanings.sent5: The defoliators swarmed the forest, leaving a trail of leafless trees behind them.

meanings.definition: Defoliators: chemicals or substances used to remove leaves from plants
meanings.sent1: The defoliators sprayed on the crops helped in weed control.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners use defoliators to manage the growth of their plants.
meanings.sent3: The defoliators accidentally spilled on the lawn, causing all the leaves to fall off.
meanings.sent4: The powerful defoliators quickly stripped the plant of its foliage.
meanings.sent5: The defoliators were so effective that the plant looked completely bare within hours.
